intro: Serjania dasyclados, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and can grow as a shrub or small tree. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
